FuncDef:
The ip-trunk command adds a POS interface to an IP-Trunk interface.
The undo ip-trunk command deletes a POS interface from an IP-Trunk interface.
By default, no POS interface is added to an IP-Trunk interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an IP-Trunk interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.

Examples: Warning: The encapsulation protocol of the link will be changed.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Trunk is a technology that bundles multiple physical interfaces into a logical interface. The logical interface is a trunk interface and the bundled physical interfaces are member interfaces.
Trunk interfaces are classified into two types: Eth-Trunk interfaces and IP-Trunk interfaces. Only Ethernet interfaces can be bundled into an Eth-Trunk interface, and only POS interfaces can be bundled into an IP-Trunk interface. Ethernet interfaces and POS interfaces cannot be bundled into the same Trunk interface. This is because Ethernet interfaces are applicable to a broadcast network, whereas POS interfaces encapsulated with High-Level Data Link Control (HDLC) are applicable to a point-to-point network.
To add an interface to an IP-Trunk interface for load balancing and link backup, you can run the ip-trunk command. The link layer protocol of the interface to be added to the IP-Trunk interface must be HDLC.
To delete a member interface from the IP-Trunk interface, you can run the undo trunkport command.
Prerequisites
Member interfaces cannot be configured with Layer 3 attributes or any service.
The link layer protocol enabled on member interfaces must be HDLC.
Configuration Impact
After POS interfaces are added to the IP-Trunk interface:
The bandwidth is increased. The bandwidth of the IP-Trunk interface is the total bandwidth of all member interfaces.The reliability is improved. When a member link fails, traffic is automatically switched to other available links.If the IP-Trunk interface is configured with services, members of the IP-Trunk interface take over these services.

Precautions
When adding a POS interface to an IP-Trunk interface, note the following:
The link layer protocol of the POS interface to be added to the IP-Trunk interface must be HDLC.A POS interface can be added to only one IP-Trunk interface. The POS interface must be deleted from one IP-Trunk interface before joining another IP-Trunk interface.The interfaces to be added to the IP-Trunk interface cannot be IP-Trunk interfaces.POS interfaces with different forwarding capacities are not recommended to join the same IP-Trunk interface.If the interface connecting to the peer device is added to an IP-Trunk interface, the directly connected interface on the peer device must also be added to the same IP-Trunk interface.
